parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1 </name>=<value> Lights </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> local </value></part><part><name>MP Effects</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Controls whether a lamp is lit or not.
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature arma3 </title><part><name index="1"/><value> This command was originally designed to only work with CfgNonAIVehicles class "StreetLamp" only;
since <template><title>arma3</title></template> v1.92 this command was extended to work with street lights.</value></part></template> </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> lamp [[switchLight]] mode </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> lamp: [[Object]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> mode: [[String]] - Mode can be: "ON", "OFF" or "AUTO" (''lamp'' is on only during nighttime, default) </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>([[object]] 12345) [[switchLight]] "OFF";</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>[[nearestObject]] [<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>[[player]], "Streetlamp"] [[switchLight]] "OFF";</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value> <code>[[cursorObject]] [[switchLight]] "ON";</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE3</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[lightIsOn]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>
</value></part></template>

<h3 style="display:none">Notes</h3>
<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on September 16, 2013
<dt class="note">[[User:Killzone_Kid|Killzone_Kid]]
<dd class="note">
''Before <template><title>arma3</title></template> v1.92'' use [[setHit]] instead:
<code>_lamp = [[nearestObject]] [<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>[[player]], "Lamps_base_F"];
_lamp [[setHit]] ["light_1_hitpoint", 0.97];	<template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>off</value></part></template>
_lamp [[setHit]] ["light_1_hitpoint", 0];		<template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>on</value></part></template></code>

Switch all lights off in the 500 radius of player:
<code>[[private]] _lamps = [[nearestObjects]] [<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>[[player]], ["Lamps_base_F", "PowerLines_base_F", "PowerLines_Small_base_F"], 500];

{
	[[for]] "_i" [[from]] 0 [[to]] [[count]] [[getAllHitPointsDamage]] _x -1 [[do]]
	{
		_x [[setHitIndex]] [_i, 0.97];
	};
} [[forEach]] _lamps;</code>
<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
